fcinfo
[Command line tools]

Collaboration diagram for fcinfo:Description:

If called without arguments, this prints the version number and the install date (or build date if not installed). These values can be retrieved separately if called with the flags "--version" or "--date", respectively.

The flags "--cflags" and "--libs" will return the compile flags and the linker flags, respectively, that were used to build the library. Therefore fcinfo can be used to provide compiler flags: 

gcc -o exe src.c `fcinfo --cflags` `fcinfo --libs`
NOTE: Surrounding the commands with back quotes (`) causes them to execute as a command within the command. NOTE: If you used a different compiler than gcc to build FCLib, you may need to use that compiler instead of gcc.
